intro: Dichapetalum subsessilifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often narrow and sessile. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, with five petals and a prominent stamen. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
